channel.title: Thingiverse - Newest Things
channel.description: The newest and coolest things from Thingiverse.com

item.title: Support pour Post-It
item.description:
Support bureau pour des Post-It (Sticky Notes) d'un format 76mm x 76mm.

Il y a 2 STL

  • PostIt-stylo-droit.stl ------> le support du stylo se trouve à droite
  • PostIt-stylo-gauche.stl --> le support du stylo se trouve à gauche

Le support du stylo accepte des stylo d'un diamètre standard.
item.author: KiffeGrave

item.title: Detent Marks for Virpil WarBRD
item.description:
Like if you do. Comment for improvement.

Please go to Thing Files and download each part separately.

This modification is part in the joystick add-on series.

This system add detent marks to the Virpil WarBRD base. I designed them to get a tactile feedback when the stick wanders outside of the normal flight envelope of the aircraft.

Applicability:

  • Compatible with the Virpil WarBRD joystick base.

Options:

  • Detent marks:
    • 1 in the center.
      • 1 at one extremity ("AFterBurner").
      • 2 at both edges.
      • 2 midway.
      • 3 = combination of a 1-mark upper part (moustache-like) and a 2-mark bottom part.

    Print:

    • No support required.
    • Designed for filament printing, since resin isn't flexible enough.
    • Printed in PLA.
    • Trim the "elephant leg" off the parts, if any.

    Assembly:

    1. Remove both cams, the spacers and the extension spring. → Virpil's video on Youtube.
    2. Install a 3D-printed spacer, an upper and a bottom detent part instead of the metallic spacers.
    3. Put the cam assembly inside the base back in place without the metallic spacers.

    Known Issues and Planned Solutions:

    • Installing them on the X-axis would require to replace the cam bolts with longer ones. (Untested yet)


    Use the referral code STAR-TQTV-6RL5 to get 5000UEC when creating a new account for Star Citizen.
item.author: Joker_G

item.title: Wanhao D6/MPMU M8 Probe Remix for 4020 Fanduct
item.description:
Thanks to RedEyedRaven for the initial design and intinify1976 for their remix.

This is basically a mashup of the two but I made the nozzle bottoms flat for better printability and added a mount to hold a M8 inductive probe. Also went and did a section analysis to see the inside of the duct and clean up the internals a bit. Should be a perfectly smooth inside now with no artifacts.

It's way too hard to fit a 5015 in the MPMU without sacrificing build volume. Empiricus's remix is the best I've seen but the 50 dollar 5015 is a hard pill to swallow. The 4020 should be more than enough and will still push more air than the stock configuration and even dual 4010 noctuas.

Probe offset should be
X: 40.8
Y: -14.1

Follow 1bigpig's wiring diagram here and firmware tutorial for getting the M8 probe installed. You will need a springsteel pei bed to make sure the inductive probe triggers correctly.
https://www.thingiverse.com/thing:2081168

Ideally print in ABS or better, PETG should probably work if you use the model with supports. You will also need to add supports to make sure the probe mount prints correctly.
item.author: skatemaster231

item.author: kimort79

item.title: Bottle Cutter
item.description:
This is a simple bottle cutter used to transform bottles into 5mm wide strings.
This specific design uses a normal size cutter blade.
To install the blade, insert the blade inside the thinner hole (the cutting side first), push, and use a hammer if necessary to secure the blade in place.
To then transform the bottle into strings, you can find tutorials on the internet such as videos from TKOR.
Enjoy
item.author: gabouyou

item.title: Llavero Osasuna Centenario 4 colores
item.description:
Cualquier impresora de un color puede imprimirlo.
Gracias a David Valiño, Hriven. He hecho un remix de su llavero.
He imprimido a resolución de 0.15.
He empezado con blaco.
En la capa 15 he cambiado a amarillo.
En la capa 35 he cambiado a rojo.
En la capa 45 he cambiado a azul.
Aupa Osasuna!

item.title: Box for Camp Amp 2,1XL amplifier board
item.description:
Made this box for an amplifier i bought. It has a click on feature, hat allows you to put the top and bottom together.

i also added small holders for the amplifier board to make sure it is stable inside the box.

The button fits if you dont like or lost the ones that come wih the board.

I also made one for the Camp Amp 2XH amplifier board if you are interested.
item.author: ArcusTangent

item.title: H0 Zelt Einsatzleitung
item.description:
Druckbar mit Anycubic Photon Mono (Zelt geteilt i rechts und links)
Benötigt werden das Zelt und vier Abrollehälter (AB) Einsatzleitung (EL).

Bei mir besteht das Ensemble aus
• AB EL THW
• AB EL Feuerwehr
• AB EL Rettungsdienst und
• AB Fernmeldezentrale Feuerwehr.
Der letztgenannte steht nur mit der Schmalseite im Zelt. der Rest dieser Zeltseite wird mit dem Vorhang verschlossen. Anbauteile für die ABs (z.B. Lichtmast, Antennenmast, Sat-Schüssel, ...) sind dabei. Weitere Ausschmüxckungsteile (z. B. Powermoon) habe ich auch auf Thingiverse verfügbar.
item.author: Roemer1964

item.title: G39 (G36) WE 999c IdZ GBB SL-9 Like Stock expansion
item.description:
Hello there,

Couldn't find any SL-8 / SL-9 Stock conversion for my G36 GBBR build, so i was wondering if i could make one, so here it is :)
This parts is dedicated for G39 IdZ Stock.

I've tried making it stand-alone, and i can make it but it required some hardware, and printed hinge for G36 Stock was a pain in my holes, as was the weakest part of the design.

Required buildplate size: 270x205mm (or bit smaller - Anycubic 4Max Pro bed size)

Todo:

  • cheek rest / cheek riser (that's why there are holes at the back), as G39-one is always too low for any optics.

Instruction:

  1. Take off the back part of the stock by rising stock setting lever (or however You call it)
    2 .put it between stock's front and back part,
  2. Put stock's back part back and lock it in place by setting lever.
    / if You are struggling with the lever just pull it out by removing pin, place the part in the stock and replace the lever with pin.

I can share my Fusion360 if You paypal me, as it took me just a little bit too much filament for prototyping, hope You understand. ;)

item.title: Hobbit House (Heroscape)
item.description:
This is my tribute to my all time favourite world of Lord of the Rings.

It is designed to fit in for HeroScape tiles and totally compatible with my other Pillbox designs, so you can make a nice hobbit house yourself!

Planning to do some side and topparts hill-scaped and some Pillbox parts with round doorways in it.

The Stl's can be printed supportless, and glued together.
Used color scheme:
darkbrown filament. Drybrushed completely with ocher yellow to give it a nice wood-look.
Used a thinned egg-yellow color for the exterior, and ivory white for the interior.
Dark green for the door and bushes.

Credits to Rodde for making the frontpart of the house which I used in this remix.

item.author: Namurei

item.title: How Apple AirPlay & AirPlay Mirroring works
item.description:
In 2004, Apple introduced AirTunes that allowed users to stream wireless music between devices. Later, the system has been extended to support photos and video, and recently also games. The name has changed to AirPlay. But how exactly does AirPlay work? How good is the quality when streaming wirelessly and how to do screen mirroring on AirPlay? FlatpanelsHD will guide you through this in-depth article.

In this article, we examine how AirPlay works. If you are looking for how AirPlay can be used in everywhere scenarios check out our Apple TV review.

Introduction to AirPlay
AirPlay has been developed by Apple and allows users to stream music, movies, photos, and games from one Apple device to another AirPlay-enabled device. AirPlay works in different ways depending on what device you are streaming to. You can for example stream video to an Apple TV or audio to a sound system with built-in AirPlay. You can also keep the video feed on your iPad and stream only audio to your stereo system. AirPlay Mirroring allows you to clone the entire desktop on a Mac or the home screen on an iPhone & iPad to the TV screen.

Stream video, pictures, and music from an Apple device over to the TV screen with AirPlay
Stream video, pictures, and music from an Apple device over to the TV screen with AirPlay

AIRPLAY IS OFTEN COMPARED TO DLNA BUT THERE ARE FUNDAMENTAL DIFFERENCES BETWEEN THE TWO STREAMING SYSTEMSAirPlay is often compared to DLNA, which is an open system where users can stream music, photos, and movies (not games) between devices. DLNA is incorporated into for example TVs, Blu-ray players, tablets, smartphones, and more. But AirPlay bears little resemblance to DLNA. It is fundamentally different and only a very small portion of the AirPlay system is similar. The rest is quite unique and not available from any other manufacturer today and you need to understand that AirPlay is just not the same as DLNA. Continue to learn why.

In order to understand the AirPlay system it is necessary to divide it into two components:
AirPlay
AirPlay Mirroring

It is also important to understand that two different AirPlay devices exist:
AirPlay transmitters (such as iPhone/iPad/iPod/iTunes)
AirPlay receivers (Apple TV, AirPort Express, and audio system with built-in AirPlay)

Below we take a look at how AirPlay and AirPlay Mirroring works. Throughout the article, we will also refer to iPad/iPhone/iPod Touch as “iOS devices”.

How AirPlay works
No one has been able to fully explain the AirPlay system due to Apple’s very tight control of the technology. Some elements such as the audio system have been re-engineered but that is only one component. Therefore some things remain unknown but we know enough details to understand the system and most other elements can be deduced.

AirPlay (without AirPlay Mirroring) can be divided into three elements:
Photos
Music (or audio in general)
Video

The photo element is relatively easy to understand. Here, photos are streamed from an iOS device to the TV screen via the Apple TV box. Photos are streamed without picture quality loss because the relatively small image file is sent into the cache of the Apple TV box. The delay depends on your WiFi network and the megapixel count of the image file.

The music and video elements are a bit more complex because we again have to distinguish between two different scenarios. You can either use AirPlay to:
Stream music or video stored locally on an iOS device.
Use AirPlay to stream music or video found on the internet from the iOS device. This includes internet radio and online video streaming services.

Wireless streaming of music from an iPhone to AirPlay-enabled speakers are streamed in the Apple Lossless format
Wireless streaming of music from an iPhone to AirPlay-enabled speakers is streamed in the Apple Lossless format

Let us start with music and video that is stored locally on an iOS device. Music is streamed in the Apple Lossless format at 44100 Hz in up to 2 stereo channels (no surround support so far). In other words without loss of quality. Video streaming utilizes the H.264 MPEG format without compression (except the compression in the actual video file). The video file needs to be transferred into the Apple TV cache before the video file plays and therefore you will experience some waiting time. The faster the wireless network you have, the less waiting time. Again, remember that we are talking about locally stored media files here.

AIRPLAY STREAMS IN LOSSLESS FORMAT, AND WHEN WATCHING OR LISTENING TO ONLINE MEDIA A DIRECT CONNECTION TO THE INTERNET SOURCE IS OPENED TO AVOID CONVERSION

When using internet sources for watching the video (such as YouTube or Netflix), something else happens when using AirPlay. When streaming from an internet source and pressing the AirPlay button on your iOS device, your AirPlay-enabled Apple TV box will open a direct connection to the internet source.

Useful Resources
Strongest Avatars
Snapchat

item.title: RC Drift Tyre Press
item.description: A tire press to help remove mounted RC drift car tires from the rims... Print in PLA or PETG with 0.2mm layers, a wall thickness of 1.35mm (3 walls), and a top/bottom depth of 1mm (5 layers). Sturdy enough to be used with a clamp for stubborn tires.

Model shown is free standing and doesn`t tip over.

Printed with 25% infill for weight and stability.

item.title: Purus line adapter
item.description:
An adapter to connect a 40mm sewage flex pipe (from a bathtub in my case) to a purus line water trap. Partly to strain the flow so the water trap doesn't overflow and to lead the water directly down the water trap.
Sorry about the dirty water trap picture
